translated: The Group of Discourses🔽The Sub-chapter on the Yellow Robe

analyzed: a nikkasāvaḥ kāsāva  yaḥ vattham paridahissati
translated: “He who, without casting off the yellow robe,🔽will put on another garment,
having departed from self-control and truth,
he does not deserve the yellow robe.
But he who, having cast off the yellow robe,
is well-composed in the moral precepts,
he indeed deserves the yellow robe.”🔽The Birth-Story of Kāsāva (first).
